headline: Salisbury Steak with Mushrooms
description: This Salisbury steak with mushroom gravy recipe features seasoned beef patties and an easy homemade sauce for a classic, comforting dish.

video.description: Watch how to make a classic Salisbury steak dinner.
video.name: Salisbury Steak with Mushrooms

name: Salisbury Steak with Mushrooms

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, chopped onion, egg, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl until evenly mixed. Shape beef mixture into 4 patties, about 3/4-inch thick.

Fry patties in a large skillet over medium heat until browned on both sides, about 10 minutes. Add beef broth, onion, and mushrooms; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until patties are no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes more. Transfer patties to a platter and keep warm.
Bring onion mixture to a boil. Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl; stir into onion mixture. Cook and stir until onion gravy is thickened, about 1 minute. Pour over patties to serve.

review.reviewBody: It was great. After frying the beef patties, I sauteed the onion and mushrooms in the drippings first. I used beef stock instead of broth for a richer flavor. I also added 3 cups of stock to make more gravy. This recipe is a keeper.
Easy peasy, however I added Italian seasoning, onion soup mix, and Worcester shire sauce to mixture. Thank you for sharing this recipe.
This is the bomb! Exactly the way i like, no love my Salisbury steak!! Thank you for sharing!
Very good but a little bland. Will try it with Italian crumbs or Lipton soup mix next. I think that would do it. Any combo of your favorite spices! Healthy and hearty!

We loved it! Easy recipe. Very flavorful. I used Italian flavored breadcrumbs. Generous black pepper. I served it with saut√©ed spinach with olive oil and garlic. I will definitely prepare this meal again. I served it over pot pie style noodles üòä
Cooked it for the guys at the firehouse and everyone loved it!
No leftovers. My guys loved it!
This is a family favorite, even for the one who said they don't like salisbury steak! I do caramelize the onions and mushrooms and continue doing so in the pan while browning the meat. Delicious!!
Edible, but no flavor whatsoever. It turned out exactly how it looks in the picture, but the actual meat is flavorless. Add a lot more salt and pepper.
It was very good. I will make this again. I didn't have mushrooms to add to it but it was still good
Was simple and amazing!

Loved it!! Tasted amazing and my entire family ate it like they were starving. Made with mashed potatoes and made extra gravy. Basically doubled the recipe for my house. Amazing!! This is my go to Salisbury steak recipe from now on.
This turned out excellent. Will definitely make again.

OMG. Don't change a thing. Recipe followed to a "T" and was simply amazing. If you want to make changes, add eye of newt, and wing of bat, then please post your own recipe so that we can all carve it up, and change it by adding Cilantro & removing the water. This one is perfect just the way it is. No changes required. Thank you so much for taking the time to post it. Kudos üëç.

I made this recently and it was REALLY good. My husband complimented it, as well, and he rarely eats beef. I'll definitely make this again. Following comments from some other reviewers, I browned the patties and then removed them from the pan. I cooked the mushrooms and onions for a bit before returning the steaks to the pan and finishing up the recipe as written. The only change I'd make next time is that I'd use several different types of mushrooms to get even more flavor.
Very good, made it straight from the recipe
Like it very easy. Have made it before
Very good.

This was everything I was hoping for when I set out to look for a salisbury steak recipe. I doubled it and used dry onions for the meat mixture. I did not used the sliced onions since I didn't have one. I'll be making this regularly!

Fabulous! Even low carb hating husband approved! I try to eat low carb, and always looking for recipes that I can use ground pork instead of hamburg which is even easier on the budget. I also use finely ground pork rinds for bread crumbs. I do a large batch and store in freezer. Freezing them removes the odor and flavor..they taste and smell like bread crumbs. I also use flour instead of cornstarch for thickening.

I recently made Salisbury steak, and my patties fell apart before I could get them to the table. One tip mentioned in other reviews pies is to refrigerate the patties for two hours before cooking. Pretty sure that will help keep the patties intact.
Threw in a little worcestershire sauce
The best recipes for you all are good for you

I used this recipe over and over. I used cubed steak this time, floured dredged and salt and pepper saut√©ed in cast iron in EVOO, both sides until browned well then removed from pan. Saut√©ed onions and mushrooms in the pan for 10 minutes then added about two table spoons of the flour/S&P dredge I had left over and mixed in well to the onion and mushrooms until all the flour was well incorporated and let cook on medium low for 3-5 minutes, then added about two cups beef stock and a tablespoon of beef bullion, and about 1/2 cup of heavy cream and stirred I. Well to fully incorporate. Seasoned again to taste, layer the steaks on top of the onion/mushroom gravy and put in a 275 degree oven for about 2.0 minutes while I made the mashed roasted garlic potatoes and saut√©ed green beans. Turned out amazing!

The flavor definitely takes me back to my childhood when I had Salisbury steak and mashed potatoes in the foil tray with the berry crumble‚Ä¶except it tastes homemade, the beef isn‚Äôt mushy, and the onions and mushrooms are fresh! You can make this as organic/grass-fed and healthy version as you want! I followed the recipe, but I did saut√© the onions and mushrooms and transferred it onto a plate before I browned the patties. Then, I deglazed the pan after the patties browned with some red wine before adding the stock. It was simple and delicious, like a warm hug of a meal from the past. If you‚Äôre feeling nostalgic for the foil tray of yore, this is it! Even if you‚Äôre not, this is a tasty, hearty and simple dish ??
This is my go to meal when the grandkids come over they love it ( so do I What did I do different? NOT A THING. It‚Äôs great as written.

For as simple as this is, it‚Äôs delicious and has lots of flavor. And the meat is so tender. I only used a half onion but otherwise followed the recipe. I made it with a side of rice and green beans. Will definitely make again!

Hubby is allergic to onions so I've left them out and it was delicious. I've made this several times now and a splash of whershisher sauce and flour slurry to thicken the sauce are the only changes I've make now. So good that it's on our regular rotation.

Absolutely delicious! It is a bit complex in the dish department but the recipe is rather simple. Just whatever you do, use actual beef broth of some form, because the condensed stuff is way too salty.
Excellent meal. Learned a new way to make gravy! Added onions more pepper and italian seasoning...delicios!
Delicious the only I would change next time I‚Äôll add more mushrooms!
Yum. Very good. Will make again.
Made this recipe as written. Fantastic. The only thing I will do differently is cut the salt in half. Just a personal preference.
This was my first time making Salisbury Steak and it turned out great and it was very easy to make. Thanks!!
We love this recipe and make it often. I always follow the recipe as is and make no changes or additions. My kids always say ‚Äúway better than the frozen kind!‚Äù

I made the meat mixture ahead and chilled for a bit to let the flavors combine. When it was time to cook I made the patties and then prepped the rest of the ingredients. This was super easy and turned out great! I will be making this recipe again in the future.
The recipe itself was great but I added more onions and extra mushrooms . I made more gravy and it turned out delicious !!
Delicious. I had to substitute the beef broth with golden mushroom soup but it was delicious.
Added teaspoon of worcestershire & soy sauce, half teaspoon dry mustard & tablespoon of ketchup. Added pioneer Gravy mix in addition to beef stock.

I always make a recipe as is the first time...it was so yummy!

I am adding a note to try with some diced up green pepper. My mom made it that way when I was little.

But I would make again with no changes! Family agrees!
I also have made this recipe for years. It is a classic comfort food recipe, even without the mushrooms, the onion gravy is delicious. With mashed potatoes and fresh green beans....yummy.
I added lipton beef onion soup. Tastes great!
No changes...great as submitted!
This was bursting with flavor Loved it!

When I watched the video I was a gast at the cooking poor cooking techniques of this recipe and the use of cornstarch should be reserved for Asian cuisine, in my opinion. 
I made many tweaks in this recipe..
I used 1 lb. of 10% ground beef and ground pork or ground turkey would be fine.
2 eggs, Worcestershire sauce, I just use a few pieces or crustless sourdough bread, cubed and soaked and smashed with fork in the egg and dash of 1/2&1/2 or cream ( Panade) as I never seem to have breadcrumbs..( the panade will keep patties moist and together during cooking. )
I saut√©ed onions and mushrooms in a few T. of butter with 2 T. Flour sprinkled in AFTER browning the patties in butter and olive oil.. removed and cover on plate to keep cozy.
Getting back to the onions, mushrooms and flour...add 1 T. Ketchup or tomato paste to saut√©, stirring add 1 glass of dry white wine, a few minutes later add beef stock and a few sprigs of thyme adjust S&P and I like to whisk in a tsp. of Kitchen Bouquet browning sauce. Add the patties or football shaped thick patties is what I like back to the sauce and cover on lowest heat for 10-20 minutes spooning sauce/onion, mushrooms over.
I add chopped flat leaf parsley to finish and serve with egg noodles.
I know it seems I totally hijacked this recipe but this recipe needed to be edited.
Added Worcestershire sauce and Montreal seasoning per others suggestions!

My husband raved over this recipe and had seconds. I tweeked the recipe by using two brown gravy packets and 1 1/2 tsp of Better Than Bouillon roasted beef base. Also used thick cut 1 lb. Portobello mushroom.
One of our favorites
This was absolutely yummy. My husband and I loved it and next time I‚Äôll double the recipe to have for another meal later in the week.

It was really good. I subbed in impossible burger meat and it worked out great. The only change I would make is to use less cornstarch and actually put the onion gravy mix in a blender to make it thicken up.
Easy and quick. This is a great comfort food recipe. Love with mashed potatoes and a green veggie.
Very good! Will be making this again!
This is so awesome just as is!
I love this recipe. Brings back childhood memories of my Mom serving this.
Recipe was very easy. I used canned mushrooms instead of fresh.

I used to think Salisbury Steaks were disgusting. These have great texture and flavors! This is plain enough for picky eaters but very satisfying nonetheless! Perfect winter comfort food. I follow the recipe as stated. It has a few important steps and to me, is actually kind of fun to make. Pair this with thick, homemade noodles and you‚Äôve really got a winner.

Like this recipe a lot. Easy to tweak to individual tastes. I made a double batch and use a little more cornstarch to get the gravy to the consistency I wanted. But then again I‚Äôm not that great a cook. So I probably didn‚Äôt do something quite right! It still turned out yummy!!!
This recipe is perfect. I served it with egg noodles and the extra gravy goes great on the noodles. I always get rave reviews every time I make it.
1-18-21 ****This was a great meal. Served with mashed potatoes.
Delicious! I followed recommendation of removing meat after cooking and keeping warm and then cooking gravy. I served with green beans and mashed potatoes. My husband devoured it!
Recipe was easy to follow I did add more mushrooms. It was very flavorful.
I add worcestershire sauce on to the gravy. It turned out delicious

We made this recipe tonight and loved it! We made homemade mashed potatoes, mac and cheese and spinach for a Sunday dinner on Saturday!! All the sides were great with the Salisbury steak. The onion and mushroom gravy was so good. Will make again. Thanks!
So easy, so quick! Great comfort food on a cold night.
I made this exact recipe with ground turkey instead of beef and chicken stock instead of beef stock, was just as good.

I followed this excellent recipe as written with the exception of adding more beef broth because it was reducing too quickly. This is true comfort food! I will definitely be making this again and again!
Delicious! I used almond meal instead of bread crumbs and arrowroot powder instead of cornstarch.
It was excellent my husband loves this recipe
Easy to make and extremely good.
I love this food. It reminds me of my childhood, with an adult flare. The only thing I changed was I formed the meat into meatballs and added extra mushrooms.
Absolutely delicious! My wife even liked it and she usually hates this kind of thing.
This was excellent!! I didn't add more onions to gravy...there was enough in the patties. My husband loved it! Having it two nights...yay!
I made this ....but I also added Worcester Sauce and dry onion soup mix. It was yummy.
I have made a few salisbury steak recipes but they were never quite like my moms until I found this recipe. I don't have to search anymore cause this is the one! Absolutely delicious!
This was OK, it lacked flavor. I think the instructions should be changed to read saut√© the mushrooms in butter first, they were sort of large, flabby and tasteless without being saut√©ed.
I made this for dinner tonight and it was a huge hit. The meat was very tasty and moist. Needed no tweaking. I‚Äôll make this again soon.

This was a great recipe - clear and quick! The whole family loved it 
I've only ever had Salisbury Steak in a TV dinner so the gravy was fresh and the meat was tender. Served it with whipped potatoes (so we could make gravy lakes). Will definitely make it again and try adding some more flavour. Great as is though! Thanks for posting!

Absolutely delicious. Did as others suggested, I removed the browned patties and sauted the mushrooms and onions and deglazed with a touch of red wine. Also did the roux butter and flour. House smells delicious. This is a keeper for sure. Oh, I also added a splash of worchester sauce to the meat and gravy. Thank you for a great recipe!!

I made it exactly to the recipe. It was fantastic! I made it for a firehouse full of firefighters and they all loved it. They said it brought them back to when they were kids. It is now in the rotation of meals we make . Great meal and easy to make. HFD

I haven't made salisbury steak in over 10 years as a recipe I used to make was lost to me. This was a GREAT recipe and I've saved it to my personal box. It was flavorful, easy and the family loved it. Would definitely recommend for either novice or experienced cook!
This recipe is really good, my husband loved it. I didn‚Äôt make any changes.
Have not made this dish in 20 years, very good, the whole family enjoyed it. Served with mashed potatoes and broccoli
Great recipe but I did add spice and could have increased the garlic and seasoning.
Very tasty. Used seasoned salt in gravy & sweet onion. Even my hubby liked it & he hates onion.
I have made these over and over again and they are wonderful and very easy to make! The only thing I do differently is I add extra mushrooms lol we love them!
Very good! Served over rice.
This is excellent. I used McCormick‚Äôs Montreal Steak seasoning in place of the pepper and saut√©ed the mushrooms. I also used ground organic beef from 1/4 cow we buy locally. Outstanding!
This is really good. I‚Äôll be making this one again! Quick and simple
No. Worked from the recipe this time.

I‚Äôve made this dish several times. The only thing I have changed is that I omitted the mushrooms, as no one in my household likes them. Other than that, follow the recipe exactly. If your family isn‚Äôt a fan of onions, remove them from the patties but don‚Äôt omit them from the gravy!! They are essential to the flavor. My husband will eat two patties and my kids eat one each. And my kids are super picky!! It‚Äôs an easy, go-to when I‚Äôm short on time and ideas. I usually serve this with potatoes-mashed, fried, or baked stacks-and fresh green beans. I might do a grilled zucchini dish next time just to change it up. This recipe will definitely stay in my favorites.
big hit!

Wonderful and simple! Just seasoned the meat again after making patties out of them and added generous amounts of onion to the gravy (we like onions). My partner was over the moon when I made this! Thanks for sharing.
Oh, heck yes! Splurge on the slightly more fatty beef. Totally worth it!!

I love Salisbury Steak. When ever I want to make something I Google it and look for the one that has the highest rating, I open them and read the recipe and decide if that's the one l want. I looked at a lot of recipes and this one really stood out. It's easy, no obscure ingredients that you'll only use once. I went by the recipe and did not alter anything. It is perfect just like that. It's now the only one I use when I make it. I have over 50 different recipes, from right here. I just never thought to put them in my collection. And I have an account. But I will be saving them from now on. Really good.
I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out great. Doubled this and made in an electric skillet with mashed potatoes and cucumber salad. Quick weeknight dinner.
I made this today ..was really great, easy to follow..!
This is an excellent recipe! My boyfriend absolutely loves it! And you probably have all the ingredients on hand already. No special trip to the store! Very simple with big taste. Love this recipe!
It was a bit bland. I made it again but added a package of onion soup dry mix and red onions. I used sherry to thicken the gravy.
Loved this!
